canonical.name: Pi
canonical.title: 22. Pi / Elegance
canonical.judgment: Pi indicates that there should be free course in what it denotes. There will be little advantage however if it be allowed to advance and take the lead.
canonical.image: The trigram representing a mountain with that for fire under it form Pi. The superior person, in accordance with this, throws a brilliancy around their various processes of government, but does not dare in a similar way to decide cases of criminal litigation.

1.text: shows one adorning the way of their feet. They can discard a carriage and walk on foot.

3.text: shows its subject with the appearance of being adorned and bedewed with rich favours. But let them ever maintain their firm correctness, and there will be good fortune.

4.text: shows one looking as if adorned, but only in white. As if mounted on a white horse, and furnished with wings, they seek union with the subject of the first line, while the intervening third pursues, not as a robber, but intent on a matrimonial alliance.

5.text: shows its subject adorned by the occupants of the heights and gardens. They bear their roll of silk, small and slight. They may appear stingy; but there will be good fortune in the end.

6.text: has its subject with white as their only ornament. There will be no error.
